meanings.definition: Having a sharp or tapered end.
meanings.sent1: The pencil with the pointiest tip wrote the neatest letters.
meanings.sent2: The cat's ears were the pointiest feature on its head.
meanings.sent3: The pointiest thorn on the rose pricked the gardener's finger.
meanings.sent4: Her wit was the pointiest weapon in her arsenal.
meanings.sent5: The pointiest mountain peak pierced the sky like a needle.

meanings.definition: Reaching the highest level of sharpness or prominence.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's joke was the pointiest of the evening, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The star athlete's skills were the pointiest in the entire team.
meanings.sent3: The pointiest moment of the play had the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: Her criticism was the pointiest among all the reviewers.
meanings.sent5: The pointiest star in the sky shone brighter than the rest.
